div.p:
The TPLOT element belongs conceptually in WRITING TEXTUALFEATURES . It addresses overview summaries of narrative actions. Encloses a statement, either brief (the complicated plot involves several switched partners before the multiple marriage ending) or a whole paragraph (or more: renew tag in new

) tracing the way the story unfolds. It must contain at least one full sentence. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements or attributes.

div.codeblock: <TPLOT>In this Eliza Fenwick novel for children, Carlo, who would become famous as the dog of Drury Lane, is rescued as a puppy by several children. The story ends with his opening as a member of the cast at Drury Lane.</TPLOT>
<TPLOT>Christian Isobel Johnstone's novel revolves around the birth of a child to a poor mother who dies in childbirth.</TPLOT>

div.p: Try to avoid tagging lengthy (paragraph-long) descriptions of obscure novels.
